data.name: SLO — /v1/ask P95 Latency < 1s
data.description: Ensures user-facing LLM requests meet latency expectations.

data.name: TraceForge – Request Availability
data.description:
Measures the percentage of TraceForge requests that are successfully served.
Requests are considered successful when their final status is OK or DEGRADED.
Only requests with status=ERROR are treated as failures.

data.name: TraceForge – Request Latency p95
data.description:
Measures the percentage of time slices in which the 95th percentile (p95) end-to-end
request latency for TraceForge is within the defined threshold.

This SLO reflects user-perceived performance by ensuring that the majority of
requests complete within an acceptable response time. Short-lived latency spikes
do not immediately impact the SLO; sustained latency degradation consumes the
error budget.

data.name: TraceForge – Tool Reliability – weather
data.description:
Measures the reliability of a specific external or internal tool used by TraceForge.
A tool invocation is considered successful when it completes without error.
Failures include timeouts, execution errors, or unavailable tool responses.

This SLO helps detect unstable or degrading tool dependencies before they
significantly impact end-user requests.

data.name: TraceForge – Response Quality SLO
data.description:
Measures the percentage of TraceForge responses that meet the defined quality
threshold based on automated evaluation signals.

A response is considered successful when its overall quality score meets or
exceeds the configured threshold. The overall score is derived from multiple
evaluation dimensions including faithfulness, relevance, policy compliance, and
hallucination risk.

This SLO ensures consistent, reliable, and trustworthy AI responses at scale and
provides early detection of quality degradation before it impacts users.
